ISSUE.TITLE: tput: No value for $TERM and no -T specified error when exec -it into container
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue Description I have an Oracle database in a container, and when I attempt to exec -it into the container with our command line tool (SQLcl), I see the following messages: ``` tput: No value for $TERM and no -T specified tput: No value for $TERM and no -T specified ``` I also ran the `podman machine ssh journalctl -r` command and found the following error (in places where the timestamp coincides with the `exec` command). Here is an excerpt: ``` Oct 11 10:06:07 localhost.localdomain podman[78544]: @ - - [11/Oct/2023:10:06:07 -0400] "GET /v4.7.0/libpod/exec/ec805299be7541937952f2d782b0f661347d7213b4a9973e06612b6115df3b0a/json HTTP/1.1" 200 441 "" "Go-http-client/1.1" Oct 11 10:06:07 localhost.localdomain podman[78544]: @ - I created a volume (21cvol), then I started a container with the following line: `podman run -d --name 21cdb -p :1521 -v 21cvol:/opt/oracle/oradata container-registry.oracle.com/database/enterprise:21.3.0.0` 2. Once that container was healthy, I logged in like this (using the port assigned by podman): `sql sys/password1234@//localhost:41465/ORCLPDB1 as sysdba ` - **No issues here** 3. When I attempt to login with` exec -it`, that's when I see the issue. The command I used: - `podman exec -it 21entdb sql sys/password1234@//localhost:1521/ORCLPDB1 as sysdba` - `podman exec -i --tty 21entdb sql sys/password1234@//localhost:1521/ORCLPDB1 as sysdba` 4. That's when I noticed these two lines: ``` tput: No value for $TERM and no -T specified tput: No value for $TERM and no -T specified ``` 7. ### Describe the results you received I've never seen this before and I'm not sure what has changed. ### Describe the results you expected I don't think this belongs here.
